law.catch_line: Effect of person wearing body armor and carrying deadly weapon at time of offense.
law.text: Any person who was found guilty of a felony offense under KRS Chapters 218A, 507, 508, 509, 511, or 513, or KRS 237.040, 514.100, 525.020, 525.030, 527.040, 527.070, 527.100, or theft of a motor vehicle under KRS 514.030, and who was wearing body armor and was armed with a deadly weapon at the time of the offense shall not be granted probation, shock probation, parole, conditional discharge, or any other form of early release.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 606, sec. 183, effective July 15, 1998.
